job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: There were not any pros.
cons: Applied for a position (for which the compensation was poor for the field and education required) and was selected for an all-day interview (for which I was not reimbursed for the day of work I had to lose because of this). Was then told in a generic email a few weeks later that the position was no longer being filled. The email did not even contain so much as an apology. This is completely unprofessional and I would advise others to not even waste their time applying here.

review_title: Great students, beautiful campus, lots of office politics
job_title: Coordinator in Newport News, VA
pros: The students are smart, driven, and passionate about their education which makes working with them very rewarding.
cons: Many people are very set in their ways and it can be difficult to get buy-in for people (faculty, staff, administration) to want to participate in new things. People are often told to stay in their lane when they are just trying to collaborate with other departments. The university's handling of the pandemic and diversity issues have involved numerous missteps. Very little opportunity for career growth, offices are small, so there is often no way to move up.

pros: Great benefits. Nice colleagues. Plenty of local options for lunch, including on-Campus eateries.
cons: Not much. The office I was in was very formal; you had to wear a suit, which seemed ridiculous given other nearby departments had business casual. Little to no flexibility in working hours: I would have preferred to work early but it seemed that everything started at 8 or 8:30 and that was it. That's just not how businesses work nowadays.

job_title: Front Desk Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros: Christopher Newport is a fast-growing and dynamic University that really puts its students first. Students love the faculty and staff and really value what they do. There is also numerous opportunities for student employment and growth within the University. Also the University is really building itself up so there is lots of opportunities for new careers within the university. I think the best aspect about CNU is that you know you are part of something that is rapidly growing into something wonderful. When you work at CNU, especially right now, you feel as if you are laying its foundation and creating something great for the future.
cons: Because the University is so new and small there is a lot of new faculty and staff. However, that is rapidly changing as more professors are getting tenured. Also, because the university is so new it is still getting a sense of itself and what it wants to be. There are lot of somewhat strict and dated rules that should be re-evaluated. Also, the faculty and staff is very young and it is also trying to find its true purpose. However, despite this, the progress at the University is remarkable and CNU is well on its way to becoming the premier university in Virginia.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros: The campus is beautiful and has great options for lunch. Helping students and parents can be rewarding at some points, and you will meet some great coworkers along the way. The expectation for customer service quality is very high, which can be good for you if you apply to other customer service jobs with another company.
cons: The expectations for appearance and customer service quality are very, very high. You must always look presentable and cannot show tattoos, have a non-natural hair color, have facial piercings, or have multiple ear piercings (lobes are okay but cartilage/etc. is discouraged). You must always look busy, even if you're not. If anyone in the higher administration walks by and is unhappy with your appearance/work performance, they can report you to your supervisor/director. You can present ideas to improve the office or university as a whole, but 90% of the time, the traditional, already-established methods will be preferred.

job_title: Student Affairs Coordinator in Newport News, VA
pros: Retirement plan was a plus. Being immediately vested as AP faculty was helpful. Camaraderie among other entry level employees. Students are incredible!
cons: So, so much nepotism in hiring practices for full-time openings. Fear-based culture steeped in micromanagement under the guise of “impression management.” Employees aren’t allowed to chew gum, wear sunglasses on the top of their heads, or use the word “retreat.” Requires business professional attire for entry-level positions where you don’t make enough money to afford a business professional wardrobe. Expectations of working beyond 40 hours a week without acknowledgement of flex time or compensation. One of the lowest salaries in the entire state of VA for entry level Student Affairs roles based on cost-of-living. Don’t be offended if you don’t get hired, they like hiring unqualified alums!

review_title: Would not make it a career
job_title: in Newport News, VA
pros: Business casual dress in the summer. Open parking only when students are on breaks. Folks are nice and usually helpful.
cons:
Employees must pay for parking decals but are sometimes forced to park in rarely used parking garage to make sure "guests" can park easily. Should be dedicated parking lots for staff/faculty.
Employees are not encouraged to seek training opportunities.  Yearly town hall meetings conducted by the President are mandatory. Money spent on building new buildings but not on recruiting and retaining much needed professors.

review_title: I have a great relationship with my coworkers, but a sour relationship with the management.
job_title: Student Employee for IT Faculty Support in Newport News, VA
pros: It's a good job to have if you have a lot of homework; you can work on it during the slow periods. Most of the coworkers are great.
cons: The rules and procedures change weekly and the changes often don't make sense. When we try to voice our issues, we are generally ignored or refused. There are no opportunities to get a raise or a promotion. Morale is generally low.

review_title: The Best Place in Newport News
job_title: Security Officer in Newport News, VA
pros: Everybody, from visitors to tenured faculty, is friendly. You get a big dose of small town hospitality in a modern, suburban package. There are numerous employment opportunities, such as food service, law enforcement, education, financial, and administrative, to name just a few.
cons: It's a state government employer, so you have to deal with the two-week-offset paychecks (up to a month before your first paycheck). The community is extremely vanilla, so for the law enforcement aspect, if you're a action-seeker, you're going to have a dull time.

job_title: Assistant Manager in Newport News, VA
pros: There are a few perks to each position and the state benefits are great, especially for families. The campus is always well taken care of and safe.
cons: The pay is terrible and it’s pretty much impossible to get a raise. The management is awful, all the way up to the President. The higher ups only care how everything looks and is presented rather than functionality.

review_title: Intern ship at Jefferson Lab: flexible scheduling and a very productive career opportunity.
job_title: Intern in Newport News, VA
pros:
I was at Jefferson Lab so this review is based on that:
$10/hr
Flexible schedule
Work part time during the semesters and full time during breaks (Summer, Winter, Spring, etc)
Excellent group of individuals to work for
Was given many projects on my own to solve and complete
Assisted with group projects as well, was not just given menial tasks to complete by myself
cons:
Did not work directly with professor, can be either a pro or a con depending on the professor
No other cons that I can think of

review_title: Library Media Center - Great Place to Work
job_title: Media Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros:
-The staff and employees at Christopher Newport University are very friendly, tolerant, and willing to assist you with problems or questions you may have.
- There are opportunities for promotion as a student worker if you develop expertise in a particular area such as Photoshop, image editing, image scanning, or cover design for DVDs.
cons:
-The working environment can be noisy when students are near the work space.
-The student positions only pay minimum wage.

review_title: Awful experience with supervisors and administration
job_title: in Newport News, VA
pros: The only pros of working here are the prestige of the university and the fact that you have a job.
cons: University administration cares only about its facade, not about its staff or students. Supervisors were rude and only cared about themselves. Office morale was low. Poor salary. No performance reviews. No opportunity for advancement. University is located in a run-down and unsafe area.

job_title: Tour Guide in Newport News, VA
pros: I loved the atmosphere of the campus. The student body is very friendly and engaging. The opportunity to be a tour guide is very much cherished; about only 10% of the total student population is selected for this role. Great experience in public speaking, training, leadership. Much of the program is run by students (while they do have managers to oversee everything). Rigorous hiring process to ensure correct students are selected.
cons: some of the employees do not take the job as serious as others.

job_title: Student Staff in Newport News, VA
pros: Every member of the staff is warm and very welcoming, and everyone greets each other as friends. It's a relatively casual office setting, but one is still expected to dress themselves at a certain business-appropriate standard. Hours are pretty flexible, and it's an easy-going job for students!
cons: My only challenge so far this year has been getting up early, but other than that I don't really have any issues!

job_title: IT Support Staff in Newport News, VA
pros:
Good University. Friendly faculty, staff and students. Customer service based, students first atmosphere.
Campus is centrally located in a nice environment. Good benefits, competitive salary.
cons: Endless construction, this is a double edge sword. Newer facilities are nice. However, over a decade of construction projects, re-routing traffic patterns, parking issues and noise. It gets weary on the soul and takes away the peaceful serene environment of the past.

job_title: Student Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros: The people are fantastic to work with. The environment is very loving and the supervisors/managers are understanding of class schedules.
cons: Minimum wage. Tasks can become repetitive and daunting depending on the area of the Business Office you are in.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Newport News, VA
pros: Fun job, flexible hours, positive environment, good hourly pay
cons: Not many hours to go around, so don't plan on supporting yourself off the job. Perfect for some easy pocket money while you're a student.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Newport News, VA
pros: The students are passionate and hard working. Junior faculty are energetic and engaging. The grass is always green, even when it's not.
cons: Senior administration aggressively games the US News system, to the detriment of both students and faculty, to increase the school's ranking.

job_title: Student Mail Room Worker in Newport News, VA
pros: Working in the mail room is arguably one of the best places to work as a student. The manager is amazing at working with your schedule and really makes you feel like a part of the mail room family.
cons: There aren't any cons to working in the mail room!

job_title: Dining Room Attendant in Newport News, VA
pros: Awesome atmosphere, great coworkers. Overall the experience was great. They are willing to work with you regarding schedule changes if you give them enough time.
cons: Fast paced, some employees are loners. Pray that nothing breaks down, because everything comes to a halt.

job_title: University Fellow in Newport News, VA
pros: I worked as a University Fellow from 2009-2010.  Great professional development opportunities and staff was exceptionally friendly.
cons: State budget uncertainty from 2007-2010 created some concerns over job security.  There were some lay offs but from my understanding the budget situation has improved.
